728949f-a.title: Richmond: Holland Avenue - Arlington Place
728949f-a.text:
138 Holland Avenue, west side, between Arlington Place and Macormac Place, showing the exterior of a frame dwelling. The house does not have a water supply and drinking water is obtained from a pump in the yard. As the dwelling is situated near the Downey Shipbuilding Corporation yard, and is one of a number of similar ones, it is very likely that it is inhabited by the shipyard workers
and their families.
About 1910
Committe on Housing
Charity Organiration Society
728949f-a.folder: Holland Avenue & Arlington Place, Staten Island, NY

728950f-b.title: Richmond: Holland Avenue - Arlington Place
728950f-b.text:
182 Holland Avenue, west side, between Arlington Place and Tufts Place, showing two views of a workers' dwelling. The house, one of a number of similar ones, is situated near the shipyard of the Downey Shipbuilding Corporation and is, in all likelihood, inhabited by the shipyard hands and their families. The sign over the front doorway reads Nooks and Raseta. Bachmann Lager Beer.
About 1910
Views 1, 2
Cormmittee on Housing
Charity Orgafisation Society
728950f-b.folder: Holland Avenue & Arlington Place, Staten Island, NY
